dialog: It appears the delivery service hath committed this deed.
In that case, we ought to bring this matter to their attention forthwith.
Greetings, Mr. Johnson. I am pleased thou hast found the time to meet with me. There is no finer setting for our discussion today, the ambiance in this place is delightful.
Fear not, for I always make it a point to mix business with leisure when the opportunity presents itself. Now, pray tell, what more canst thou tell me about these confections thou art offering?

Well, as thou art aware, I have recently become the exclusive distributor of Grangers Gourmet Bon-bons throughout the United States. They are a new manufacturer, seeking to make their mark in the luxury market. Thy restaurant immediately came to mind, as I believe it embodies many of the same qualities as Grangers. Adding these chocolates to thy menu shall further establish thy reputation for providing first-class, elegant, and luxurious dining.
Hmmm, intriguing... Gourmet chocolates, are they produced in Belgium, perchance?
Nay, the factory is located in Scotland.
Truly? I was not aware Scotland was renowned for its luxury chocolate production.

That is precisely what makes this such a remarkable opportunity! The government is fully supportive of creating new markets for exports and hath guaranteed a low tariff for wholesale orders of more than a thousand units. They have also streamlined the customs process. Here, I brought these specifically for thee. Try one!
Oh, thank thee. Mmm, the texture is creamy, very smooth...

Unusual, are they not? I wager thou hast never tasted anything like it! The quality is guaranteed, for I personally visit the factory to ensure that no shortcuts are taken with the ingredients. Only the finest make it through my inspection.
Indeed, the flavors are most intriguing... Slightly spicy, quite unique. Pray tell, what exactly are the ingredients?

I have it on the utmost authority that this traditional secret recipe hath been passed down through the Granger family for generations. I am confident thou canst keep a secret. Buttermilk, cacao beans, sugar, and Haggis.
Haggis? What is Haggis?
It is a traditional Scottish delicacy. One stuffs sheep's liver, heart, and lung inside the sheep's stomach.
Ah, I shall respond anon.
Mr. Johnson? Mr. Johnson?
Dost thou require a guide?
Aye, we are seeking one. What is the daily fee?
A mere 20 Galleons a day it is, and if ye plan on stayin' for more than three days in the city, 'twill be 16 Galleons per day.
